document.title: ยง127.422. Health Science Theory (One Credit), Adopted 2021

23DFCCD742864E99A298A6AE2DBBCA2A.description: explain the changes in structure and function of the body due to trauma and disease.

CAF2BF75F3DF4D4B9AA609709399ADF1.description: research alternative health practices and therapies; and

B3C05948666E4BF381F1FD425F5C3B84.description: research and analyze the effects of access to quality health care;

DDF0BA069C8146F7BFEFF768D979DC0F.description: explain the benefits of positive relationships between community members and health professionals in promoting a healthy community;

BC2B561A84F8459D8EB6B6E1F15BDFB2.description: evaluate positive and negative effects of relationships on physical and emotional health;

98ACA3E6F6024526B240D3C22D3A9A0C.description: research wellness strategies for the prevention of disease;

7A3B7C72E0344BAA9AB808F7C96762E8.description: ) The student assesses wellness strategies for the prevention of disease. The student is expected to:

371323A309F244F5B58F5C62B88FEB94.description: demonstrate proper body mechanics to reduce the risk of injury.

9887A45BC564407F9431273CE00B661B.description: identify the benefits of recycling and waste management for cost containment and environmental protection; and

96BF6400C5BE4A7C868DF41A87A8BFD2.description: describe how to assess and report unsafe conditions;

7C675CA9D2C245C99F1B87CC5AEE8A5B.description: explain protocols related to hazardous materials and situations such as personal protective equipment (PPE) and blood borne pathogen exposure;

9C7CF7A09D7F45EF8399B0AA876C1AFD.description: describe governmental regulations and guidelines from entities such as the World Health Organization (WHO), Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC), Occupational Safety and Health Administration (OSHA), U.S. Food and Drug Administration (FDA), The Joint Commission, and the National Institute of Health (NIH), and Texas Department of State Health Services (DSHS);

B1203A5F7E4B4F86A238D4B5C4A7FF4F.description: ) The student maintains a safe work environment. The student is expected to:

608BD8F1A9234BAE8A8E247A9AE20946.description: assess group dynamics in real or simulated groups; and

ABBDB16E3E71476BB5F64111049B5CC3.description: identify essential leadership skills of health science professionals;

D9A9C28C20394DBD9D676D711C2CF7D6.description: ) The student exhibits the leadership skills necessary to function in a healthcare setting. The student is expected to:

76E83021C43546C6B0B6B067B7C47DDC.description: investigate the legal, ethical, and professional ramifications of unacceptable or discriminatory behavior.

17653C1EC92E40C5AB50007499A336AA.description: examine legal and ethical behavior standards such as Patient Bill of Rights, advanced directives, and HIPAA; and

483B05D392B24F78A10F71E1EC824262.description: research and describe the role of professional associations and regulatory agencies;

82E5FB0E9C1D43129A16D5B29919BC72.description: ) The student evaluates ethical behavioral standards and legal responsibilities of a health science professional. The student is expected to:

A88327B73DC640B7908E6574B0D8F665.description: identify basic skills specific to a health science profession such as medical assistant, dental assistant, emergency medical technician-basic, phlebotomy technician, and pharmacy technician.

4B7AABE504EE400F8179A1AB659A1F05.description: demonstrate first aid, vital signs, cardiopulmonary resuscitation, and automated external defibrillator skills; and

FCD59CB117904D2FB958000484E79C7E.description: role play techniques used in stressful situations such as situations involving trauma and chronic and terminal illness;

FB2EF4E8EED24E9EBAB286BDED8572D7.description: demonstrate skills related to assessing range of motion and assisting with mobility, including positioning, turning, lifting, and transferring patients for treatment or examination;

9981B0B34EE14892887DCEDC9F810B16.description: determine proper equipment needed for patient ambulation such as gait belts, wheelchairs, crutches, or walkers;

F0D2F905E84C48EB878120A4E8B04080.description: demonstrate skills related to assisting patients with activities of daily living such as dressing, undressing, grooming, bathing, and feeding;

739DCFDF281440B18914CC54BDE82798.description: perform admission, discharge, and transfer functions in a simulated setting;

50D36767DBF04CEAA144BBA2C116B7A9.description: employ medical vocabulary specific to the healthcare setting;

019F134E91F84099BCC1A11CDE57B0C4.description: comply with specific industry standards related to safety requirements;

ABFA223B169445E9B08DCA90BE95C14D.description: The student demonstrates comprehension and proficiency of clinical skills used by health science professionals in a classroom or clinical setting. The student is expected to:

83BC5B1910CA455B8A151B964EF5BF35.description: suggest modifications to a decision or plan based on healthcare outcomes.

64FB72B64085401BBE15F9A1848E594D.description: evaluate the impact of decisions in health science; and

8A7AD419A90546DA9803E21FF1D9840E.description: apply critical-thinking, adaptability, and consensus-building skills to solve problems relevant to health science;

91D009EC5F5D48F992429DFAA54374B4.description: The student identifies problems and participates in the decision-making process. The student is expected to:

80BF7AB256264A30AE60C24715F05817.description: practice employment procedures for a specific health science career such as resume building, application completion, and interviewing.

22CB2AAD422244F1BF9352BBF620D466.description: research education, certification, licensing, and continuing education requirements and salary related to specific health science careers; and

FB080C44EDA6401CB4A73A3A176A9BA5.description: The student describes industry requirements necessary for employment in health science occupations. The student is expected to:

843AB9846A74498BA76E348A94B7E2B9.description: record health information on paper and electronic formats such as patient history, vital statistics, and test results.

7A0B45A508664C9B992C6CD0E859ED28.description: prepare health documents or records according to industry-based standards; and

83EAE7C2236145AFB4196E7FB1484956.description: research document formats such as dental or medical records;

BAACBC0281034CFFABF95236FC42116A.description: The student documents and records medical information into a permanent health record. The student is expected to:

FF04B1A672C14EE191A64C87D8132ECD.description: evaluate the effectiveness of conflict-resolution techniques in various simulated healthcare workplace situations.

32BD1D020F694A1380D5FCF7AC7752BE.description: demonstrate strategies for communicating needs, wants, and emotions in a healthcare setting; and

71B7DDF065FD4764B8B5D79CE33B0EF3.description: identify the role of communication skills in building and maintaining healthy relationships;

705338B43AD64F509FC2A4AFD906E16B.description: evaluate how healthy relationships influence career performance;

94A0395BA23440DD8DDCB65FCC514A08.description: The student analyzes and evaluates communication skills for maintaining healthy relationships in the healthcare workplace. The student is expected to:

81A7F48152744EDF982B7A1E0D620852.description: use electronic communication devices in the classroom or clinical setting appropriately.

D8659107F96844ACA0C823C442E7595D.description: use appropriate verbal and non-verbal skills when communicating with persons with sensory loss and language barriers in a simulated setting; and

EA3F8767B22847EF86906CE25BB07887.description: demonstrate therapeutic communication appropriate to the situation;

7FCF8DF9ACBA446D8A16FDA3E9DF16D9.description: The student demonstrates verbal, non-verbal, and electronic communication skills. The student is expected to:

BBF59795FECB492EBB0D67AC44D58F59.description: research topics related to health science such as the global impact of disease prevention.

85395D809B414FA9BEB6708DAC9DBA4F.description: summarize biological and chemical processes in the body such as maintaining homeostasis; and

0FBC0F5FCD8442F890864B896839F988.description: interpret complex technical material related to the health science industry;

26FBF06F9D064F0D9D5DB6FA4376894E.description: express ideas clearly in writing and develop skills in documentation related to health science;

F4EE1318664146539790FD87C6EE2174.description: solve mathematical calculations appropriate to situations in a healthcare-related environment;

5313BD5496C540F0A6B3EFDAD45EC8CE.description: The student applies mathematics, science, English language arts, and social studies in health science. The student is expected to:

B98D407D67794336ABB910768F85FF8D.description: comply with Health Insurance Portability and Accountability Act (HIPAA) policy standards.

883364E7990E4E1E9598C4A0BA99A627.description: communicate medical information accurately and efficiently in language that patients can understand; and

348FED8A938B458285C366CCF02636A4.description: The student demonstrates patient-centered skills and interactions that foster trust and lead to a quality customer service experience. The student is expected to:

CDA273B849AE4D64807DDF62AAB592CB.description: model industry expectations of professional conduct such as attendance, punctuality, appropriate professional dress, proper hygiene, and time management.

A3F9B33F34C14F1BA53AC370C398F897.description: exhibit the ability to cooperate, contribute, and collaborate as a member of a team; and

4FD44C59962F4544A412ED6F616AA075.description: express ideas in a clear, concise, and effective manner;

CD08F57892D04E02B6D77EF75C7D3651.description: The student demonstrates professional standards/employability skills as required by business and industry. The student is expected to:

85F453B9F6AD4FAF95E60841FDE0493E.description: Statements that contain the word "including" reference content that must be mastered, while those containing the phrase "such as" are intended as possible illustrative examples.

57B3F5ADF35949138FF537EB9F32E7E2.description: Students are encouraged to participate in extended learning experiences such as career and technical student organizations and other leadership or extracurricular organizations.

AD567FE7D98C4F33B5479FA9AE51ABCB.description: Professional integrity in the health science industry is dependent on acceptance of ethical and legal responsibilities. Students are expected to employ their ethical and legal responsibilities, recognize limitations, and understand the implications of their actions.

235F27E324784C23B9034F4F282E5369.description: The health science industry is comprised of diagnostic, therapeutic, health informatics, support services, and biotechnology research and development systems that function individually and collaboratively to provide comprehensive health care. Students should identify the employment opportunities, technology, and safety requirements of each system. Students are expected to learn the knowledge and skills necessary to pursue a health science career through further education and employment.

BBB662136F50428498D2EEEDB5231E6A.description: To pursue a career in the health science industry, students should learn to reason, think critically, make decisions, solve problems, and communicate effectively. Students should recognize that quality health care depends on the ability to work well with others.

09BAA779CE864EC9950319DAD01B8EDC.description: The Health Science Theory course is designed to provide for the development of advanced knowledge and skills related to a wide variety of health careers. Students will become familiar with industry-based standards for documenting and maintaining medical information; research industry employment requirements, including education, certification, and licensing requirements; and evaluate ethical and legal responsibilities of health science professionals. Students will employ hands-on experiences for continued clinical knowledge and skill development.

DEF435B35E854475A804493DB73014EF.description: The Health Science Career Cluster focuses on planning, managing, and providing therapeutic services, diagnostic services, health informatics, support services, and biotechnology research and development.

5F1E376AB3F84792BE2F02AA1EB172B1.description: Career and technical education instruction provides content aligned with challenging academic standards, industry-relevant technical knowledge, and college and career readiness skills for students to further their education and succeed in current and emerging professions.

95D8C4983D604F75BE4F8961C30C6A83.description: General requirements. This course is recommended for students in Grades 10-12. Prerequisites: one credit in biology and at least one credit in a course from the health science career cluster. Recommended prerequisite: Medical Terminology. Recommended corequisite: Health Science Clinical. Students shall be awarded one credit for successful completion of this course.

A87DB8CDA0D7409A8708053342DDD656.description: If the commissioner does not make the determination that instructional materials funding has been made available under this subsection, the commissioner shall determine no later than August 31 of each subsequent school year whether instructional materials funding has been made available. If the commissioner determines that instructional materials funding has been made available, the commissioner shall notify the State Board of Education and school districts that this section shall be implemented for the following school year.

D084E819FAF541E3AC06EFA8C2A0855E.description: If the commissioner makes the determination that instructional materials funding has been made available, this section shall be implemented beginning with the 2024-2025 school year and apply to the 2024-2025 and subsequent school years.

C219274E587840F8AD84F16B76EAB32A.description: No later than August 31, 2024, the commissioner of education shall determine whether instructional materials funding has been made available to Texas public schools for materials that cover the essential knowledge and skills identified in this section.

B5189FC1D35A41319409269CCD8C5692.description: Implementation. The provisions of this section shall be implemented by school districts beginning with the 2024-2025 school year.
